{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3600498,"name":"Amanda Bessette","username":"Amanda_B","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T20:01:29.063Z","cooked":"

WPILib was thrilled to once again be part of the celebration in Houston! We enjoyed connecting with so many of you. A huge congratulations and shout out to Thad House, for being named Volunteer of the Year! Your dedication and contributions to the community are inspiring — thank you for everything you do.

Conference Session Recap
This year WPILib hosted two conference sessions:

  • XRP + WPILib: We demonstrated how WPILib integrates with the XRP platform which is a great tool for learning fundementals
  • SystemCore Software Updates: We shared an update of software development and methodologies we are embracing. The presentation slides can be found here.

We’re also working on a virtual option for those who couldn’t attend in person — stay tuned for more information!
Thank you to everyone who joined us at the sessions and stopped by our booth. We hope you are as excited for REBUILT™ presented by Haas, as we are!

Amanda_B:

XRP platform

I attended this session and I was wondering if it was possible to get the FIRST team discount on the XRP through DigiKey? I found where I can apply on SparkFun but as a MN team and with the DigiKey voucher, I’d much prefer to order from there.

You can send an email to xrp@digikey.com to apply for the discount

Unfortunately I wasn’t able to make it to the presentation (volunteering as an inspector), but the slides sound really exciting. I’m especially looking forward to having a more integrated software ecosystem across FRC and FTC, since that’s been a major barrier for 8592 supporting the FTC teams at our makerspace.

Can “generate” into a Python code project but can’t turn Python back into Blockly

Is this a “not interested” or a “too hard”? It is possible to programmatically generate Blockly or build blocks through an API. Microsoft MakeCode does Static Typescript to Blockly, and I’ve done something similar for a work hackathon (unfortunately I can’t share that code). If Python-to-Blockly translation is a feature WPIlib would be interested in having, I’d be willing to help set it up.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-04-23T06:03:48.021Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":548,"readers_count":547,"score":169.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":500192,"topic_slug":"wpilib-blog-wpilib-2025-championship","display_username":"Robert Marsh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/makecode","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Microsoft MakeCode","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19076,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 8592 M/2186A/CSA/RI"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-blog-wpilib-2025-championship/500192/4","custom_user_title":"FRC 8592 M/2186A/CSA/RI","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3601036,"name":"Christopher149","username":"Christopher149","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-23T05:31:32.305Z","cooked":"

Any change is probably going to annoy me in some way, but I will be so happy to be able to have the command-based structure in FTC and be able to more easily combine simultaneous auto actions because that right now is a pain for us. Too bad it’s still a few years out.

And glad to see that subsystems will continue to have their own periodic functions since we do that a fair bit for controlling arms and elevators.

rdmarsh:

. If Python-to-Blockly translation is a feature WPIlib would be interested in having, I’d be willing to help set it up

Im not super familiar with the setup wpilib is planning on using, but I’d imagine the set of valid python programs is a superset of the set of python programs generated by blocky, which would make translation back difficult.

rdmarsh:

If Python-to-Blockly translation is a feature WPIlib would be interested in having, I’d be willing to help set it up

Honestly I don’t see the value; as programs get more complex we should be promoting students to transition to text-based code.
